item.title: On The Terrace, just off Kilburn High Road, 15th August
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kilburn High Road, London

item.title: Path on Pomeroy Estate in desperate need of weeding, 15th August
item.description:
Paths need weeding and branches cutting back. The overgrowth is providing hiding places for anti social behaviour, including urination, defecation and drug use. Residents have been asking for this for months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 125, Pomeroy Street, New Cross Gate, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown trees blocking the footway, 15th August
item.description:
Overgrown an unmaintained conifers between the “School house” and number 2 Frederick crescent are blocking the pavement, often causing pedestrians to have to walk in the road if there is a couple of people or someone with a buggy or wheelchair, as it is close to the school entrance it is even more of a concern, it extends about 3 foot from the property perimeter

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frederick Crescent, Ponders End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Hedge overhanging the highway from private property

item.title: Bushes overhanging the footway, 15th August
item.description:
As you enter Frederick crescent from green street, a Buddleia plant is well overgrown and an issue for pedestrians. The plant in is the side garden of No 46 Green street which is like a dumping ground for the property owner. It is an area not accessible for the tenants of number 46 but their landlord should be made to clear up the garden space which is like a dumping ground and often rats run to and from the area!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Frederick Crescent, Ponders End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Hedge overhanging the highway from private property

item.title: Utilities manhole cover loose, 15th August
item.description:
Westbound, otherside of road to 85/87 Okehampton. Two covers, one on right hand side (I believe) rattles loudly when driven over. Frustrating for residents given how loud it is.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Okehampton Crescent, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction on the public path, 15th August
item.description:
The footpath at the top of Green Street following the construction of the cycle lane in 2020is a shared space between cyclists and pedestrians, it’s a busy and often cars are parked there all the time, at present the pavement on the opposite side of Green Street is unsafe for pedestrians due to a burst water main 10 days ago, a business is placing a number of planters fixed to the ground at a height of about 3 foot encroaching on this shared space, this poses further ricks to pedestrians making the area even more confined as they approach a bus shelter, most of those parking illegally on the footway here are also associated with this business, staff, customers, deliveries etc I have photos above showing the bricked area which is public space, also there is access to water points, I believe this was previously pointed out to the business by LFB.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Street, Ponders End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: FD67 PKA Mercedes Black abandoned untaxed, 15th August
item.description:
A car has been possibly abandoned on the LIngey Close estate opposite Nos 4 and 5 in visitor car parking space for over 15 weeks and nearly 16 weeks without moving. The registration number is FD67 PKA and is a grey Mercedes . I have tried telling Bexley Council but they say its on your land and I am wondering if it has been stolen but cant seem to find anywhere on the Met Police web site that I can highlight this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 125, Old Farm Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
